main: ^Spoliarium is created by Juan Luna on 1884. It took 8 months to complete this majestic art.

c-0: ^The setting of the painting is believed to be a Roman circus – a venue for public events under the Roman Empire. It features dying and dead gladiators who have been stripped of their weapons and garments.

^The painting shows the Juan Luna’s socio-cultural and political views and also his affections. It portrays gladiators who were once the symbols of splendor, but now after their defeat, they are treated like slaves.
